p: Candida parapsilosis is a fungal species of yeast that has become a significant cause of sepsis and of wound and tissue infections in immunocompromised people. Unlike Candida albicans and Candida tropicalis, C. parapsilosis is not just a human pathogen, having also been isolated from non-human sources such as domestic animals, insects and soil [ 68]. C. parapsilosis was the second most common Candida species isolated from normally sterile body sites of hospitalized patients. It accounted for 15.5% of Candida isolates in North America, 16.3% in Europe, and 23.4% in Latin America, outranked only by C. albicans (51.5%, 47.8%, and 36.5%, respectively) [ 68].
